listitem.para: int8_t extract_file (FILE *fptr, struct directory_record *dr, const char *path)
extractor.h - container for all file extraction functions.
int8_t extract_directory (FILE *fptr, const uint16_t block_size, const char *path)
Creates a directory and then extracts every file in said directory.
Creates directories for every directory in a given path table and then extracts all of its files.

section.title: create_directories_and_extract_data_from_path_file()

para.computeroutput: int8_t create_directories_and_extract_data_from_path_file (FILE * fptr, uint16_t block_size, struct path_table * pt)

para.para: Creates directories for every directory in a given path table and then extracts all of its files.

section.para: A wrapper for extract_directory and, therefore also, extract_file which handles the extraction of every file and subdirectory using a given path table.

entry.para: logical block size (in big endian form).

para.para: Creates a directory and then extracts every file in said directory.

section.title: extract_file()

para.computeroutput: int8_t extract_file (FILE * fptr, struct directory_record * dr, const char * path)

para.para: extractor.h - container for all file extraction functions.

section.para: All functions return zero on success, non-zero on failure. Extracts a file using its respective directory_record and data pointed to by fptr, outputting it to the location denoted by path.
the file_identifier terminates with a ; character followed by the file ID number in ASCII coded decimal (1). See: https://wiki.osdev.org/ISO_9660#Directories
Just use the default/existing filename. It'll be incorrect, but probably not worth stoping execution over. Users could just manually remove the ;1 part; the data itself should be fine.
Definition at line 26 of file extractor.c.
